improvements: Decrease highlights by 40-50% to attempt recovery of detail in the blown-out white sky.
Increase shadow brightness on the dog's face by 15-20% to counteract the backlighting and reveal eye detail.
Crop approximately 10-15% from the right side to position the subject's eye on the upper-right rule of thirds intersection, reducing empty space behind the head.
Apply a slight warm filter or increase color temperature by 5% to remove cool blue casts from the white fur.
critiques.notes: The subject focus and depth of field are excellent, rendering the dog sharp against a soft background. However, the image suffers from a heavily overexposed sky and slightly unbalanced composition caused by the subject looking out of the frame rather than into it.

improvements: Increase overall exposure by 15-20% to recover detail in the white fur and reduce the blown-out background
Apply selective sharpening to the eyes and nose area to enhance subject focus
Crop tighter using rule of thirds, positioning the dog's face in the right third to balance the negative space
Increase contrast by 10-15% and reduce highlights by 20% to add dimension to the white fur
Add a subtle vignette to draw attention away from the overexposed sky toward the subject
critiques.notes: The image has good subject positioning and pleasant natural lighting, but suffers from overexposure in the background and lack of detail in the white fur. The composition is acceptable but could be stronger with tighter framing. Improving contrast and recovering highlights would significantly enhance the overall impact.
